Let $P^T$ be the transpose of $P$. Consider the $(i,j)$-th entry of $P^T P$: $(P^T P)_{ij} = \\sum_{k=1}^n (P^T)_{ik} P_{kj} = \\sum_{k=1}^n P_{ki} P_{kj}$. If $i \\neq j$, then the $k$ that gives $P_{ki} = 1$ is different from the $k$ that gives $P_{kj} = 1$ (since each column has exactly one 1). Therefore, for all $k$, either $P_{ki} = 0$ or $P_{kj} = 0$, so $P_{ki} P_{kj} = 0$. Thus $(P^T P)_{ij} = 0$. Hence $P^T P = I$. Similarly, we can show $P P^T = I$. Therefore, $P^T = P^{-1}$."
}
```
